verses.kjv: Concerning the Ammonites, thus saith the LORD; Hath Israel no sons? hath he no heir? why then doth their king inherit Gad, and his people dwell in his cities?
verses.ct: About the Ammonites, the LORD says this: Does Israel have no sons? Does he have no one to inherit? Then why has Milcom taken over Gad, and why do his people live in its towns?

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard in Rabbah of the Ammonites; and it shall be a desolate heap, and her daughters shall be burned with fire: then shall Israel be heir unto them that were his heirs, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: So pay attention — the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will sound the battle cry against Rabbah of the Ammonites. It will become a pile of ruins, and its surrounding villages will be burned to the ground. Then Israel will take back what was taken from them, says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Howl, O Heshbon, for Ai is spoiled: cry, ye daughters of Rabbah, gird you with sackcloth; lament, and run to and fro by the hedges; for their king shall go into captivity, and his priests and his princes together.
verses.ct: Wail, Heshbon, because Ai has been destroyed! Cry out, people of Rabbah! Put on rough cloth, mourn, and run back and forth among the walls, because Milcom will be taken into exile along with his priests and officials.

verses.kjv: Wherefore gloriest thou in the valleys, thy flowing valley, O backsliding daughter? that trusted in her treasures, saying, Who shall come unto me?
verses.ct: Why do you brag about your valleys — your fertile valley, you unfaithful people? You trusted in your wealth, saying, 'Who would dare attack me?'

verses.kjv: Behold, I will bring a fear upon thee, saith the Lord GOD of hosts, from all those that be about thee; and ye shall be driven out every man right forth; and none shall gather up him that wandereth.
verses.ct: Look, I am going to bring terror on you from every direction, declares the Lord GOD of hosts. Each of you will be driven away in panic, and no one will gather the refugees.

verses.kjv: And afterward I will bring again the captivity of the children of Ammon, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: But afterward, I will restore the fortunes of the Ammonites, declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Concerning Edom, thus saith the LORD of hosts; Is wisdom no more in Teman? is counsel perished from the prudent? is their wisdom vanished?
verses.ct: About Edom, the LORD of hosts says this: Is there no wisdom left in Teman? Have the wise lost their ability to give advice? Has their understanding disappeared?

verses.kjv: Flee ye, turn back, dwell deep, O inhabitants of Dedan; for I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, the time that I will visit him.
verses.ct: Run away, turn back, hide yourselves deep underground, people of Dedan! Because I am bringing disaster on Esau — the time when I will punish him.

verses.kjv: If grapegatherers come to thee, would they not leave some gleaning grapes? if thieves by night, they will destroy till they have enough.
verses.ct: If grape harvesters came to you, wouldn't they at least leave a few grapes behind? If thieves came at night, they would only steal what they wanted.

verses.kjv: But I have made Esau bare, I have uncovered his secret places, and he shall not be able to hide himself: his seed is spoiled, and his brethren, and his neighbours, and he is not.
verses.ct: But I have stripped Esau completely bare. I have exposed all his hiding places, and he won't be able to conceal himself. His children are destroyed, along with his brothers and his neighbors — he is gone.

verses.kjv: Leave thy fatherless children, I will preserve them alive; and let thy widows trust in me.
verses.ct: Leave your orphans behind — I will keep them alive. And let your widows put their trust in me.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD; Behold, they whose judgment was not to drink of the cup have assuredly drunken; and art thou he that shall altogether go unpunished? thou shalt not go unpunished, but thou shalt surely drink of it.
verses.ct: The LORD says this: If those who didn't deserve to drink from the cup of punishment still had to drink it, do you really think you'll escape without punishment? You will not escape — you will definitely drink from it.

verses.kjv: For I have sworn by myself, saith the LORD, that Bozrah shall become a desolation, a reproach, a waste, and a curse; and all the cities thereof shall be perpetual wastes.
verses.ct: I have sworn by myself, declares the LORD, that Bozrah will become a wasteland, an object of horror, a ruin, and a curse. All its towns will be permanent ruins.

verses.kjv: I have heard a rumour from the LORD, and an ambassador is sent unto the heathen, saying, Gather ye together, and come against her, and rise up to the battle.
verses.ct: I have received a message from the LORD, and a messenger has been sent to the nations saying, 'Assemble yourselves! March against her! Get ready for battle!'

verses.kjv: For, lo, I will make thee small among the heathen, and despised among men.
verses.ct: Look — I will make you insignificant among the nations, despised by everyone.

verses.kjv: Thy terribleness hath deceived thee, and the pride of thine heart, O thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, that holdest the height of the hill: though thou shouldest make thy nest as high as the eagle, I will bring thee down from thence, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: The terror you inspire has deceived you, along with your arrogance, you who live in the crevices of the cliffs and occupy the mountain heights. Even if you build your nest as high as an eagle's, I will bring you down from there, declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Also Edom shall be a desolation: every one that goeth by it shall be astonished, and shall hiss at all the plagues thereof.
verses.ct: Edom will become such a wasteland that everyone passing by will be shocked and will gasp at all its wounds.

verses.kjv: As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour cities thereof, saith the LORD, no man shall abide there, neither shall a son of man dwell in it.
verses.ct: Just like the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah and the towns around them, says the LORD, no one will live there — not a single person will settle in it.

verses.kjv: Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan against the habitation of the strong: but I will suddenly make him run away from her: and who is a chosen man, that I may appoint over her? for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before me?
verses.ct: Watch — like a lion coming up from the thick brush along the Jordan to attack a secure pasture, I will suddenly chase them away from it. And who is the chosen one I will put in charge of it? Who is like me? Who can challenge me? What leader can stand against me?

verses.kjv: Therefore hear the counsel of the LORD, that he hath taken against Edom; and his purposes, that he hath purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out: surely he shall make their habitations desolate with them.
verses.ct: So listen to the plan the LORD has made against Edom and what he intends for the people of Teman: Even the weakest of the flock will drag them away. Their homeland will certainly be made desolate because of them.

verses.kjv: The earth is moved at the noise of their fall, at the cry the noise thereof was heard in the Red sea.
verses.ct: The earth shakes at the sound of their collapse. Their cry of anguish can be heard all the way to the Red Sea.

verses.kjv: Behold, he shall come up and fly as the eagle, and spread his wings over Bozrah: and at that day shall the heart of the mighty men of Edom be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
verses.ct: Look — the enemy will rise up and swoop down like an eagle, spreading his wings over Bozrah. On that day, the warriors of Edom will feel like a woman in the agony of labor.

verses.kjv: Concerning Damascus. Hamath is confounded, and Arpad: for they have heard evil tidings: they are fainthearted; there is sorrow on the sea; it cannot be quiet.
verses.ct: About Damascus: Hamath and Arpad are in a panic because they have heard terrible news. They are overcome with anxiety — restless like a churning sea that cannot be calmed.

verses.kjv: Damascus is waxed feeble, and turneth herself to flee, and fear hath seized on her: anguish and sorrows have taken her, as a woman in travail.
verses.ct: Damascus has lost its strength and has turned to run. Panic has gripped the city. Pain and anguish have seized it like a woman giving birth.

verses.kjv: How is the city of praise not left, the city of my joy!
verses.ct: How is it that the famous city has not been abandoned — the city that was my delight!

verses.kjv: Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of war shall be cut off in that day, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: Its young men will fall dead in its streets, and all its soldiers will be silenced on that day, declares the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it shall consume the palaces of Benhadad.
verses.ct: I will set fire to the walls of Damascus, and it will consume the fortresses of Ben-hadad.

verses.kjv: Concerning Kedar, and concerning the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon shall smite, thus saith the LORD; Arise ye, go up to Kedar, and spoil the men of the east.
verses.ct: About Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated — the LORD says this: Get up, march against Kedar, and plunder the people of the east!

verses.kjv: Their tents and their flocks shall they take away: they shall take to themselves their curtains, and all their vessels, and their camels; and they shall cry unto them, Fear is on every side.
verses.ct: Their tents and their flocks will be seized. Their tent curtains, all their goods, and their camels will be carried off. People will shout at them, 'Terror is everywhere!'

verses.kjv: Flee, get you far off, dwell deep, O ye inhabitants of Hazor, saith the LORD; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath taken counsel against you, and hath conceived a purpose against you.
verses.ct: Run! Get far away! Hide yourselves deep underground, people of Hazor, declares the LORD. Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has devised a strategy against you and formed a plan to destroy you.

verses.kjv: Arise, get you up unto the wealthy nation, that dwelleth without care, saith the LORD, which have neither gates nor bars, which dwell alone.
verses.ct: Get up and attack that comfortable nation that lives without a worry, declares the LORD — a people with no gates or bars on their doors, living in isolation.

verses.kjv: And their camels shall be a booty, and the multitude of their cattle a spoil: and I will scatter into all winds them that are in the utmost corners; and I will bring their calamity from all sides thereof, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: Their camels will become plunder, and their large herds will be taken as loot. I will scatter to every direction those who shave the edges of their hair, and I will bring disaster on them from every side, declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Hazor shall be a dwelling for dragons, and a desolation for ever: there shall no man abide there, nor any son of man dwell in it.
verses.ct: Hazor will become a home for jackals, a permanent wasteland. No one will live there — not a single person will settle in it.

verses.kjv: The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet against Elam in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,
verses.ct: This is the message from the LORD that came to the prophet Jeremiah about Elam, at the beginning of the reign of King Zedekiah of Judah:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, the chief of their might.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says this: Look — I am going to break the bow of Elam, the source of their greatest strength.

verses.kjv: And upon Elam will I bring the four winds from the four quarters of heaven, and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there shall be no nation whither the outcasts of Elam shall not come.
verses.ct: I will bring winds against Elam from the 4 corners of the heavens and scatter them in every direction. There will be no nation where Elam's refugees will not end up.

verses.kjv: For I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies, and before them that seek their life: and I will bring evil upon them, even my fierce anger, saith the LORD; and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them:
verses.ct: I will shatter Elam's confidence in the face of their enemies and those who want to kill them. I will bring disaster on them — my burning anger, declares the LORD. I will send the sword after them until I have finished them off.

verses.kjv: And I will set my throne in Elam, and will destroy from thence the king and the princes, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: I will establish my throne in Elam and destroy its king and officials from there, declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: But it shall come to pass in the latter days, that I will bring again the captivity of Elam, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: But in the days to come, I will restore the fortunes of Elam, declares the LORD.
